intro: Hisutsua serrata, commonly known as the serrated hisutsua, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
